tool.name: CvtToFuzzy

param.name: InputField
param.dialogReference: The field containing the raw values to convert to fuzzy space.

param.name: ThresholdSettingMethod
param.dialogReference:
The method used to set the True and False Thresholds. Options include Custom Values, Min/Max, and Standard Deviations.

Min/Max sets the True and False thresholds using the Minimum and Maximum values stored in the input field.

X Std Dev sets the True and False thresholds at plus/minus X Standard Deviations from the mean of the values in the input field.

For each of these two threshold setting methods, the user needs to also choose which threshold should be greater (i.e., the directionality to use when converting to fuzzy space).

(True Threshold > False Threshold) means that the True Threshold should be greater than the False Threshold (i.e., in the case of Min/Max, the Maximum value should be the True Threshold and the Minimum value should be the False Threshold). Use this option when the larger an input value is the more True the proposition under evaluation is.

(False Threshold > True Threshold) means that the False Threshold should be greater than the True Threshold (i.e., in the case of Min/Max, the Maximum value should be the False Threshold and the Minimum value should be the True Threshold). Use this option when the smaller an input value is the more True the proposition under evaluation is.

param.name: FalseThreshold
param.dialogReference:
The cutoff value used to determine when a proposition becomes totally False (-1).

If the True Threshold is > False Threshold, raw values <= the False Threshold will be totally False (-1).

If the True Threshold is < False Threshold, raw values >= the False Threshold will be totally False (-1).

param.name: TrueThreshold
param.dialogReference:
The cutoff value used to determine when a proposition becomes totally True (+1).

If the True Threshold is > False Threshold, raw values >= the True Threshold will be totally True (+1).

If the True Threshold is < False Threshold, raw values <= the True Threshold will be totally True (+1).

param.name: ResultsField
param.dialogReference: The output field name. Spaces and special characters are not allowed.

param.name: EEMSCommandFile
param.dialogReference: The path to the EEMS command file. Do not change this value, as the default entry (%EEMS Command File Path%) is a variable that stores the path to the EEMS Command File defined in EEMS Model Initialization Tool.

param.name: DisplayName
param.dialogReference: An alternative name for the Results Field providing a more human-readable description of the stored values. The Display Name may contain spaces and special characters whereas the Results Field cannot. When provided, the Display Name will appear in place of the Results Field name in the hierarchical model diagram on EEMS Online and Data Basin, as well as other web applications that consume EEMS models. This can help with model interpretation and usability.

param.name: Description
param.dialogReference: A description of the data values stored in the output field. When provided, this information will appear in the hierarchical model diagram on EEMS Online and Data Basin, as well as other web applications that consume EEMS models. This can help with model interpretation and usability.

param.name: ColorMap
param.expression: {Diverging: RdYlBu | Cyclic: hsv | Cyclic: twilight | Cyclic: twilight_shifted | Diverging: BrBG | Diverging: PRGn | Diverging: PiYG | Diverging: PuOr | Diverging: RdBu | Diverging: RdGy | Diverging: RdYlGn | Diverging: Spectral | Diverging: bwr | Diverging: coolwarm | Diverging: seismic | Miscellaneous: CMRmap | Miscellaneous: brg | Miscellaneous: cubehelix | Miscellaneous: flag | Miscellaneous: gist_earth | Miscellaneous: gist_ncar | Miscellaneous: gist_rainbow | Miscellaneous: gist_stern | Miscellaneous: gnuplot | Miscellaneous: gnuplot2 | Miscellaneous: jet | Miscellaneous: nipy_spectral | Miscellaneous: ocean | Miscellaneous: prism | Miscellaneous: rainbow | Miscellaneous: terrain | Miscellaneous: turbo | Perceptually Uniform Sequential: cividis | Perceptually Uniform Sequential: inferno | Perceptually Uniform Sequential: magma | Perceptually Uniform Sequential: plasma | Perceptually Uniform Sequential: viridis | Qualitative: Accent | Qualitative: Dark2 | Qualitative: Paired | Qualitative: Pastel1 | Qualitative: Pastel2 | Qualitative: Set1 | Qualitative: Set2 | Qualitative: Set3 | Qualitative: tab10 | Qualitative: tab20 | Qualitative: tab20b | Qualitative: tab20c | Sequential (2): Wistia | Sequential (2): afmhot | Sequential (2): autumn | Sequential (2): binary | Sequential (2): bone | Sequential (2): cool | Sequential (2): copper | Sequential (2): gist_gray | Sequential (2): gist_heat | Sequential (2): gist_yarg | Sequential (2): gray | Sequential (2): hot | Sequential (2): pink | Sequential (2): spring | Sequential (2): summer | Sequential (2): winter | Sequential: Blues | Sequential: BuGn | Sequential: BuPu | Sequential: GnBu | Sequential: Greens | Sequential: Greys | Sequential: OrRd | Sequential: Oranges | Sequential: PuBu | Sequential: PuBuGn | Sequential: PuRd | Sequential: Purples | Sequential: RdPu | Sequential: Reds | Sequential: YlGn | Sequential: YlGnBu | Sequential: YlOrBr | Sequential: YlOrRd}
param.dialogReference:
The color map used by matplotlib to render the data on EEMS Online.

Visit the URL below to view samples of the available options:

https://matplotlib.org/3.1.1/gallery/color/colormap_reference.html

param.name: ReverseColorMap
param.dialogReference: Check this box to use a reversed version of the color map.

tool.summary: Converts input values into fuzzy values using linear interpolation.
